page.title: 13Health
page.content: In the nearby village of Carlton there is a doctor's surgery which is used by most of the village. There are other surgeries in Selby. Selby also has a hospital, The War Memorial although most villagers would use York District Hospital. We have a school nurse, Mrs. Handley, who gives us tests for hearing and sight and looks through our hair. She helps look after our general health. Pregnant women would go to York or Goole as neither the village or Selby have adequate facilities. Selby deals with fractures, sprains and small wounds. Most people in the village go to a dentist in Selby or Goole. A school dentist visits the school regularly to check our teeth.
